clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of the Master Caution System (MCS) for Continuous Monitoring and Detection of Dysrhythmias and Ischemic Events
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Master Caution System for Continuous Monitoring and Detection of Dysrhythmia and Ischemia

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness and usability of the Master Caution System for 12 leads continuous monitoring of ECG signal in the ICCU.
The purpose of the study is to evaluate the effectiveness and usability of using Master Caution 12 leads Garment for stress test.
The purpose of the study is to reassess the adequate size of the Master Caution Garment.

primary_outcome.measure: Measuring 12 leads ECG information of patients at the ICCU in continuous monitoring using Master Caution System (MCS) will give more cardiac information comparing to regular hospital 2-3 leads telemetry.
Measuring 12 leads ECG information of patients at the stress test using Master Caution System (MCS) comparing to the standard of care stress test ECG device and Electrodes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Master Caution System (MCS) cardiac telemetry system will measure and provide sufficient ECG information for adequate detection and interpretation of ST-T wave changes and dysrhythmic events.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the use of the system

arm_group.description: The use of the Master Caution System (MCS) for continuous monitoring and detection of dysrhythmias and ischemic events : For patient diagnosed with acute coronary syndrome (ACS) in the intensive cardiac care unit (ICCU) before and after planed catheterization procedure.
The use of the Master Caution System (MCS) for continuous monitoring and detection of dysrhythmias and ischemic events : For patients referred to stress imaging with suspected ischemia.

intervention.description: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness and usability of the Master Caution System for 12 leads continuous monitoring of ECG signal in the ICCU. The purpose of the study is to evaluate the effectiveness and usability of using Master Caution 12 leads Garment for stress test. The purpose of the study is to reassess the adequate size of the Master Caution Garment (MCG).

study_pop.textblock:
Eligible subjects admitted and diagnosed as acute coronary syndrome, before or after catheterization, who need to be monitored for evaluation of treatment efficacy.
Eligible subjects referred to stress imaging test, with current or previously depicted STT changes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age>18 years.
- Diagnosed or have evidence of ACS, or referred for stress imaging due to suspected ischemia with STT changes.
- Needs continuous/routine ECG monitoring.
- Ability to give informed consent.
- Cooperative person
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with known allergy to silver.
- Patients with dermal disease or recent trauma to the chest wall.
- Pregnant or lactating woman.
- Patients with chest deformity precluding placement of the garment.
- Patients suffering from tremor.
- Patients participating in another ongoing trial.
